alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Yakutat (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 16 at 4:58AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following area, Northeast Gulf Coast. * WHEN...Until 100 AM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 458 AM AKDT, satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate heavy rain across the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near the Situk River, Tawa Creek, and the Lost River. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2.75 inches are possible. - Areas around 9 mile bridge, near Tawa Creek and the Lost River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - For Situk River near Yakutat: At 4:30am the stage was 70.6 feet. Flood Stage is 71.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 71.27 feet is expected around 10:00am Sunday.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
